Name: adult spinal muscular atrophy
Definition: A survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy that is characterized by progressive muscular weakness and motor disability that typically presents in the third decade of life and has_material_basis_in mutations in the SMN1 or SMN2 genes that are required for the survival of motor neurons.
Output: survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy

Name: intermediate spinal muscular atrophy
Definition: A survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy that is characterized by progressive muscular weakness and respiratory failure that typically presents in infancy and drastically reduces length of life
Output: survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy

Name: obsolete lentiginosis profusa
Definition: A survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy that is characterized by progressive muscular weakness and respiratory failure that typically presents in infancy and drastically reduces length of life
Output: survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy

Name: obsolete epidermal nevus
Definition: A survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy that is characterized by progressive muscular weakness and respiratory failure that typically presents in infancy and drastically reduces length of life
Output: survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy

Name: obsolete soldiers heart
Definition: A survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy that is characterized by progressive muscular weakness and respiratory failure that typically presents in infancy and drastically reduces length of life
Output: survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy

Name: juvenile spinal muscular atrophy
Definition: A pneumonia involving inflammation of lungs that begins in the terminal bronchioles
Output: survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy

Name: Werdnig-Hoffmann disease
Definition: A blepharitis that is characterized by an infection of the sebaceous glands of Zeis at the base of the eyelashes
Output: survival motor neuron spinal muscular atrophy
